Benjamin G. Lewis

Software Engineer

I am an engineer with a passion for technology, design, leadership, people and making a difference in the world. With my degree in electrical & computer engineering, as well as my experience as a full stack software engineer, I have developed a strong set of skills which are applicaple to a diverse set of problems.

Having been in leadership positions and involved in youth movements growing up, I have also developed people skills. Through this I am able to relate to others, understand their positions and lead them to success in what they are working with. I have applied this in leading projects proffessionally, as well as through informal coaching of other colleagues.

My proffesional goal is to be involved in technological leadership. Architecting elegant and efficient solutions to difficult problems, and leading a team to achieve success in the implementation of these.

Contact me

Experience

Zappi

Full Stack Software Engineer • April, 2017 — Present

London, United Kingdom (June, 2019 — Present), Cape Town, South Africa (April, 2017 — Jun, 2019)

Worked on the Reporting Platform, which involved mostly Ruby on Rails development, with some Python (with Pandas), GraphQL and React on the side. In this team I acted as a core repo memeber, being involved in the Security of the platform, as well as a co-owner of the Quality initiative. As part of my time at Zappi, I also spent a year and a half acting as a Scrum Master/Developer, managing the teams Agile Process whilst also writing code at the same time. This struck my passion for facilitation and led to me leading two highly successful Design Sprints which led to the discovery of key projects that are center to the future technical direction of the company.

  • Scum Master/Developer (1.5 years) Led the AutoCharting team on a full stack new feature of a key data anyltics and flexible charting framework.
  • Security Champion (2 years) Monitored the Reporting Platforms web security by resolving various vulnerabilities and through logging + monitoring.
  • Quality Team (1 year) Lead the quality team, which was a guild that focused on fixing performance/architecture issues in the platform.
  • Coach (1 year) Part of the coaching team, working with colleagues to help them overcome any issues with which they are dealing with.
  • Bump Bot Built a Flask application that was used as part of our continuous integration testing pipeline, to alert us of breaking changes from one repo to another

Lumkani

Intern in the Embedded Firmware and Testing team • June, 2016

Cape Town, South Africa

As part of my University required vacation work I interned at Lumkani, a low-cost fire detector startup suited to deployment in informal settlements.

  • Wrote C firmware for PIC-based Sniffer embedded systems
  • Facilitated the manufacturing and assembly process of Sniffer units including the writing of test firmware

Nomad Productions and Entertainment

Boss and Entertainment Manager • January, 2013 — October, 2017

Cape Town, South Africa

Entertainment for the upper-end of private events in Cape Town.

  • Successfully co-ordinated and participated in 100+ events
  • Managed marketing, quoting, invoicing, book keeping and dealing with clients in person
  • Gained strong public speaking skills from being MC at 70+ events

Education

University of Cape Town

BSc (Eng) Electrical and Comouter Enginnering • 2013 — 2016

  • Deans List (2015)

My passion in this course lay in Digital Electronics and Embedded Software. My thesis was on Doppler Based Gait Recognition (see projects below).

Projects

Beer Bot

Engineering Co-lead • 2020

The Beet Bot was a marketing project used by Zappi at IIEX in Amsterdam. It was an automated beer pouring robot that was triggered by users tweeting using certain hashtags

Doppler Based Gait Recognition (Thesis)

Author • 2016

Designed an anti-poaching system capable of detecting humans based on the way they walk using custom-built radar sensor nodes, a machine learning back-end and WiFi communication. This was done using the Hidden Markov Model, with a comparison to the K-Nearest Neighbours Model. Nominated for best project in 2016.
